title: Jessica Kristin Reese
text: Welcome to my website! I’m a second-year Ph.D. student in Government and Politics at the University of Maryland with a focus on American politics, racial and ethnic politics (REP), and the intersections of conservatism and black conservatism. My research explores the ideological barriers within Congress, voter behavior, and emerging movements like black conservatism. From pre-registering studies on Black voter sentiment to building innovative conservatism scales, my work seeks to leave a lasting impact on both academia and the Black community.

title: Research
text:
CV
My research focuses on racial and ethnic politics, with a particular emphasis on voting behavior and the evolving dynamics of Black conservatism. I aim to explore how these intersections shape political ideologies, voter perceptions, and broader patterns of political engagement in the United States.


Undergraduate Honors Thesis
Destroying the Myth of the Monolith: A Historical Observation of the Black Conservative from Then to Now
Link to Article
Reese, Jessica. 2022. “Destroying the Myth of the Monolith: A Historical Observation of the Black Conservative from Then to Now.” Honors Theses 884: 1–32.
